title: Sun Certified Network Administrator
text:
SCNA (an abbreviation of <a href="Sun%20Certified">Sun Certified</a> <a href="Network%20administrator">Network Administrator</a>) is a certification for <a href="system%20administrator">system administrator</a>s and covers <a href="LAN">LAN</a>s and <a href="Solaris%20%28operating%20system%29">Solaris</a>.
Requirements.
Candidates must pass a certification exam. The examination includes <a href="multiple-choice">multiple-choice</a>, scenario-based questions, drag-and-drop questions, and tests the candidate on Solaris network administration topics including how to configure and manage the <a href="network%20interface%20layer">network interface layer</a>, the network (<a href="internet%20layer">internet</a> and <a href="transport%20layer">transport layer</a>s), network applications, and the Solaris IP Filter.
Candidates must have three or more years of experience administering Sun systems in a networked environment.
Certification also requires already being a <a href="Sun%20Certified%20System%20Administrator">Sun Certified System Administrator</a> for Solaris (any edition).
